<Link id="l00299" /><CodeLine lineNumber="299"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// vector type members) into the values of the pointees. Such vector types</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00300" /><CodeLine lineNumber="300"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// are used for SVE VLS but there is no ABI for SVE VLS arguments and the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00301" /><CodeLine lineNumber="301"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// backend cannot lower such value arguments. The 128-bit fixed-length SVE</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00302" /><CodeLine lineNumber="302"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// types can be safely treated as 128-bit NEON types and they cannot be</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00303" /><CodeLine lineNumber="303"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// distinguished in IR.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00304" /><CodeLine lineNumber="304"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (ST-&gt;useSVEForFixedLengthVectors() &amp;&amp; <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a61d13d6824ec46c31260a4fd0997eda0">llvm::any&#95;of</a>(Types, &#91;&#93;(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> &#42;Ty) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00317" /><CodeLine lineNumber="317"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// This function calculates a penalty for executing Call in F.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00318" /><CodeLine lineNumber="318"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00319" /><CodeLine lineNumber="319"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// There are two ways this function can be called:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00320" /><CodeLine lineNumber="320"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// (1)  F:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00321" /><CodeLine lineNumber="321"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//       call from F -&gt; G (the call here is Call)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00322" /><CodeLine lineNumber="322"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00323" /><CodeLine lineNumber="323"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// For (1), Call.getCaller() == F, so it will always return a high cost if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00324" /><CodeLine lineNumber="324"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// a streaming-mode change is required (thus promoting the need to inline the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00325" /><CodeLine lineNumber="325"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// function)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00326" /><CodeLine lineNumber="326"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00327" /><CodeLine lineNumber="327"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// (2)  F:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00328" /><CodeLine lineNumber="328"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//       call from F -&gt; G (the call here is not Call)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00329" /><CodeLine lineNumber="329"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//      G:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00330" /><CodeLine lineNumber="330"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//       call from G -&gt; H (the call here is Call)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00331" /><CodeLine lineNumber="331"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00332" /><CodeLine lineNumber="332"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// For (2), if after inlining the body of G into F the call to H requires a</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00333" /><CodeLine lineNumber="333"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// streaming-mode change, and the call to G from F would also require a</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00334" /><CodeLine lineNumber="334"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// streaming-mode change, then there is benefit to do the streaming-mode</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00335" /><CodeLine lineNumber="335"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// change only once and avoid inlining of G into F.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00336" /><CodeLine lineNumber="336"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smeattrs">SMEAttrs</a> FAttrs(&#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#a96d73bbd7af15cb1fc38c3f4a3bd82e9">F</a>);</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03335" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3335"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// %2 and %res can be merged in the backend to generate fmul d0, d0, v1.d&#91;1&#93;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03336" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3336"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">auto</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> ExtractCanFuseWithFmul = &#91;&amp;&#93;() &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
